Literature Information.Literature: Peptide design: the C-terminal hydrophobic tail (residues 20 and beyond) has been repalced with a less hydrophobic tail.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (75%) toBMAP-28GRAVY: -0.91; M Wt: 3010.535; M formula: C134H226N45O34; Mol ex coeff: 7040.Activity: Active against E. coli ATCC 25922 ML-35 (MIC 0.5-1 uM), S. typhimurium ATCC 14028 (MIC 1 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 0.5 uM), S. marcescens ATCC 8100 (MIC 4 uM), S. aureus ATCC 25923  (MIC 8 uM) but MRSA >64 uM, S. epidermidis ATCC 12228 (MIC 2 uM), B. megaterium Bm11 (MIC 2 uM), C. albicans (MIC 8 uM), and C. neoformans (MIC 4 uM).Toxicity: low hemo.lytic to hRBC at 100 uM (3.3%), HC50 >100 uM.Structure: The peptide became more helical with the titration of TFE.MOA:bacteria: it permeabilizes the inner membrane of E. coli ML-35.
Literature Information.Author: Skerlavaj B, Gennaro R, Bagella L, Merluzzi L, Risso A, Zanetti M. 1996
Literature Information.Title: Biological characterization of two novel cathelicidin-derived peptides and identification of structural requirements for their antimicrobial and cell lytic activities
